docs.lead_paragraph: Here's the latest news on the U.S. presidential candidates' remarks on how to respond and prevent attacks like the one that occurred last week in San Bernadino, California. The massacre left 14 dead and 21 wounded and is under investigation by the FBI as a terrorist attack. If proved, it would be the deadliest incident on American soil since Sept. 11, 2001. All times are local.

docs.lead_paragraph: TAYLOR--Mahlon Clinton. Mahlon "Clinton" (aka Clint) Taylor, born on June 11, 1926, passed away on November 19, 2015. Clint was 89. Clint is survived by his wife Diane (Bridee) Taylor; his daughter Ingrid and favorite son-in-law Gary Stefan, his daughter Karen Taylor three sons, Mahlon C. Taylor Jr., SellmanStanley Taylor III., and Kent Taylor; step-daughters' Kimberly S. Ratzand Leigh Ann Hunt: a brother, Joseph and wife Anita. Clint was hired by Insinkerator 1989 as the New York Area Manager. As a representative for Insinkerator, he worked with the New York City Council, various New York City Departments; the Mayor's Office and many of engineers, architects, and major contractor groups. With the help of Clint's efforts, the ban on the use of Food Waste Disposals was lifted on September 11, 1997. Clint was also employed by Eljer Plumbing Ware as a New York City Regional Sales Manager from 1963 to 1974. Clint was on the Board of Directors of The Associated Builders and Owners of Greater New York, and served as Chairman of the Membership Committee. He was recognized as Associate Member of the Year by the association in November 2002. He was a member of the American Society of Plumbing Engineers/New York City and the American Society of Sanitary Engineers of New York City. Clint was a World War II Veteran-U.S. Army with the 3rd Infantry Division attached to the 7th Army under the Command of General Patton. Condolences may be given in guest book at www.burroughsfh.com. In lieu of flowers please direct your donations to any of the following: Renovation Project: VFW Post #

docs.lead_paragraph:
TAYLOR--Mahlon Clinton.

Mahlon "Clinton" (aka Clint) Taylor, born on June 11, 1926, passed away on November 19, 2015. Clint was 89. Clint is survived by his wife Diane (Bridee) Taylor; his daughter Ingrid and favorite son-in-law Gary Stefan, his daughter Karen Taylor three sons, Mahlon C. Taylor Jr., SellmanStanley Taylor III., and Kent Taylor; step-daughters' Kimberly S. Ratzand Leigh Ann Hunt: a brother, Joseph and wife Anita. Clint was hired by Insinkerator 1989 as the New York Area Manager. As a representative for Insinkerator, he worked with the New York City Council, various New York City Departments; the Mayor's Office and many of engineers, architects, and major contractor groups. With the help of Clint's efforts, the ban on the use of Food Waste Disposals was lifted on September 11, 1997. Clint was also employed by Eljer Plumbing Ware as a New York City Regional Sales Manager from 1963 to 1974. Clint was on the Board of Directors of The Associated Builders and Owners of Greater New York, and served as Chairman of the Membership Committee. He was recognized as Associate Member of the Year by the association in November 2002. He was a member of the American Society of Plumbing Engineers/New York City and the American Society of Sanitary Engineers of New York City. Clint was a World War II Veteran-U.S. Army with the 3rd Infantry Division attached to the 7th Army under the Command of General Patton. Condolences may be given in guest book at www.burroughsfh.com In lieu of flowers please direct your donations to any of the following: Renovation Project: VFW Post #10420 4359 U.S. Bypass 17 Murrells Inlet, SC 29576; Regency Hospice 600 Garden City Connector Murrells Inlet. SC 29576; The National World War II Museum--Chairpersons Ton Hanks and Tom Brokaw P.O. Box 97336, Washington, DC 20090-7336 www.national ww2museum.org

docs.lead_paragraph: Crises face the mayoralty of Rahm Emanuel, a former senior aide to President Bill Clinton, as Hillary Clinton focuses her campaign on criminal justice overhauls, the latest twist in their longtime relationship.
docs.snippet: Crises face the mayoralty of Rahm Emanuel, a former senior aide to President Bill Clinton, as Hillary Clinton focuses her campaign on criminal justice overhauls, the latest twist in their longtime relationship....
docs.abstract: Political Memo; Hillary Rodham Clinton faces conflict over her response to Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel's handling of black teenager Laquan McDonald's death at hands of white police officer; Clinton's loyalty to Emanuel, with whom she shares long and often fraught relationship, is being tested by criticisms of Emanuel's actions and her intensified focus on racial justice; Clinton, in break with Emanuel, has called for Justice Dept investigation into incident.

headline.main: Old Ties Tangle Hillary Clinton’s New Agenda
